963462632693903360.content: Thanks go to @heydonworks and @drewm for technical edits on the article. For more information on accessibility, Heydon has made an amazing resource:http://inclusive-components.design/
You should write about migrating a huge existing code base in knockout js to Vue !
I’m actually writing a book with a section on that!
Really!!! Super cool! Im a junior on a tech startup in Seattle and I proposed to move to vue js. That when well, now the problem I need to address is migration! Is there any vue community in Seattle?
I dunno, I don't live there

This reveals a weakness in Vue: you need to edit HTML, add placeholders to manipulate classes. In jQuery, you can act on existing HTML without need to insert placeholders. And this can be a significant difference.
To each their own :) I really like not having to rewrite DOM traversal if the markup changes
Not sure if you meant to do this or it was subconscious but all the jQuery examples have semicolons and the Vue ones (except one) don't.
Yeah, it's intentional- I'm writing in the style of the relative community for each
My pinky misses semi-colons
You can still have them if you want!
Try Prettier , your pinky will thank you!
Created this for every occasion when someone reads something like this.http://gph.is/2Etu0BF
I lovvvvve it
is it possible to use jquery and vue together?  i have a page with very big jquery. don't want to rewrite whole code. just parts
yeah, some people do that. It's best if you eventually move over but I know a few companies that use both in tandem
Porting an existing jquery based website to a spa. Using vue to make the code modular and for routing. Eventually plan to replace the jquery plugins with plain js or vue
any repo or sanple code?
It’s currently for a client project. But I plan to create a demo project on github later for a generic use case. Ill ping you once it’s ready
Me too please
Nice work! Maybe next time I can persuade you to use an @unpkg <script> tag
It’s never too late!
(Sorry for the double tweet. Twitter ate my URL )
This may have just triggered the lightbulb I've been waiting to turn on on this whole web dev / Vue JS thing! I've been lost in this udemy class and other guides.
That’s great to hear!
you should write that article! it's not an exclusive club or anything

Yeah sure, I would love to. But I've got some excuses: I no longer work like that, it was like 3-4 years ago, so despite I know how to do that, I won't have any fresh hands-on experience; also I want to be publishing some code and still have at least 5-6 hours of sleep daily.
I no longer work like that either ;)
The, uhm, joy of being a dev in a really small team with multiple frontends: no matter what it is, I always still work like that.
Nice article, thank you! Do you have any recommendations for articles on why to switch to Vue?
Thanks. I’ve stuck with jQuery cause the apps existed before I learned anything JavaScript, and I certainly don’t regret learning it, but am aware it’s a bit long in the teeth now.
Time to remove the comfy jQuery slippers!
You might find Vue to be even comfier!
high fives! I'm so glad it's useful
